intro: Chasmone argentea, commonly known as silver chasmone, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silvery-white leaves with a distinctive waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chasmone argentea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
